name: Zeyu Guo 0001
content: Zeyu Guo Homepage I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at the Ohio State University. Before joining OSU, I did postdocs at UT Austin, University of Haifa, and IIT Kanpur. I completed my Ph.D. in computer science at Caltech in 2017, under Chris Umans. My research interests include pseudorandomness, coding theory, algebraic complexity theory, and applications of algebraic methods in theoretical computer science. My work is supported by the NSF CAREER Award. Research Debordering Closure Results in Determinantal and Pfaffian Ideals Anakin Dey and Zeyu Guo To appear in ITCS 2026. Also available on ECCC and arXiv. Random Reed-Solomon Codes Achieve List-Decoding Capacity With Linear-Sized Alphabets Omar Alrabiah, Zeyu Guo, Venkatesan Guruswami, Ray Li, and Zihan Zhang Advances in Combinatorics, 2025. Merged journal version of [AlrabiahâGuruswamiâLi '24] and [GuoâZhang '23]. Deterministic Depth-4 PIT and Normalization Zeyu Guo and Siki Wang Manuscript. Also available on ECCC and arXiv. Gabidulin Codes Achieve List Decoding Capacity with an Order-Optimal Column-To-Row Ratio Zeyu Guo, Chaoping Xing, Chen Yuan, and Zihan Zhang The 29th International Workshop on Randomization and Computation (RANDOM), 2025. Improved Decoding of Tanner Codes Zhaienhe Zhou and Zeyu Guo The 2025 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory (ISIT), 2025. Also available on arXiv. Random ReedâSolomon Codes Achieve the Half-Singleton Bound for Insertions and Deletions over Linear-Sized Alphabets Roni Con, Zeyu Guo, Ray Li, and Zihan Zhang The 52nd EATCS International Colloquium on Automata, Languages, and Programming (ICALP), 2025. Also available on arXiv. Also available on ECCC and arXiv. Also available on ECCC and arXiv. Random Gabidulin Codes Achieve List Decoding Capacity in the Rank Metric Zeyu Guo, Chaoping Xing, Chen Yuan, and Zihan Zhang The 65th Annual IEEE Symposium on Foundations of Computer Science (FOCS), 2024. Also available on arXiv. Also available on arXiv. Extractors for Images of Varieties Zeyu Guo, Ben Lee Volk, Akhil Jalan, and David Zuckerman The 55th Annual ACM Symposium on Theory of Computing (STOC), 2023. Also available on ECCC and arXiv. Journal version in SIAM Journal on Computing, 2024. Variety Evasive Subspace Families Zeyu Guo Journal version in computational complexity, 2024. A previous version appears in the 36th Computational Complexity Conference (CCC), 2021. Also available on ECCC and arXiv. Efficient List-Decoding with Constant Alphabet and List Sizes Zeyu Guo and Noga Ron-Zewi The 53rd Annual ACM Symposium on Theory of Computing (STOC), 2021. Also available on ECCC and arXiv. Journal version invited to and published in the CCC 2018 special issue of Theory of Computing. Also available on ECCC and arXiv.
